get.summary: Get the details about a specific continent.
get.description:
Retrieve the details of a specific Continent by supplying a three letter ISO Continent code (id).  Use the following codes:
 * **AFR** = Africa
 * **ASI** = Asia
 * **AUS** = Australia
 * **EUR** = Europe
 * **NAR** = North America
 * **SOP** = Oceania (South Pacific)
 * **LAM** = South America

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The 3 letter ISO Continent Code for the Continent you want to view. Use the codes indicated above.

200.description: The details about the specific continent.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a specific country.
get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific Country by supplying the country's [2 letter FIPS 10-4 Code](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J) (id).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The 2 letter FIPS 10-4 Country Code for the Country you want to view. [View all Country Codes](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J)

200.description: The details about the specific country.

get.summary: Find all countries that match your filter criteria.
get.description: Retrieve a list of Countries that match your filter settings.

parameters.name: bible_complete
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of Primary Languages (CntPrimaryLanguages) in the country that have a Bible Status of Complete Bible.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get a total matching that number.

parameters.name: bible_new_testament
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of Primary Languages (CntPrimaryLanguages) in the country that have a Bible Status of New Testament.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get a total matching that number.

parameters.name: bible_portions
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of Primary Languages (CntPrimaryLanguages) in the country that have a Bible Status of Portions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get a total matching that number.

parameters.name: continents
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more continents to filter by.Use the following codes:
 * **AFR** = Africa
 * **ASI** = Asia
 * **AUS** = Australia
 * **EUR** = Europe
 * **NAR** = North America
 * **SOP** = Oceania (South Pacific)
 * **LAM** = South America

parameters.name: cnt_primary_languages
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of primary languages.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get countries with a total number of primary languages matching that number.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more FIPS 10-4 Letter Country Codes to filter by. See [https://goo.gl/yYWY4J](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J).

parameters.name: jpscale
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more JPScale codes to filter by. Only accepts the following codes: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.  For more information check out [https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress](https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum results to return.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to display

parameters.name: pc_buddhist
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Buddhist.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_christianity
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Christians.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_ethnic_religion
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Ethnic Religions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_evangelical
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Evangelicals.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_hindu
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Hindus.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_islam
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Islam.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_non_religious
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Non-Religious.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_other_religion
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Other Religions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_unknown
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Unkown Religions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: population
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum population.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that number.

parameters.name: pop_in_frontier
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum population living among frontier people groups.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that number.

parameters.name: pop_in_unreached
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum population living among the unreached.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Countries matching that number.

parameters.name: primary_languages
parameters.description: A bar seperated list of ISO 3 Letter Codes.  For more information check out this [code list](http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php).

parameters.name: primary_religions
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more primary religions to filter by. Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = Christianity
 * **2** = Buddhism
 * **4** = Ethnic Religions
 * **5** = Hinduism
 * **6** = Islam
 * **7** = Non-Religious
 * **8** = Other/Small
 * **9** = Unknown

parameters.name: regions
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more regions to filter by. Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = South Pacific
 * **2** = Southeast Asia
 * **3** = Northeast Asia
 * **4** = South Asia
 * **5** = Central Asia
 * **6** = Middle East and North Africa
 * **7** = East and Southern Africa
 * **8** = West and Central Africa
 * **9** = Eastern Europe and Eurasia
 * **10** = Western Europe
 * **11** = Central and South America
 * **12** = North America and Caribbean

parameters.name: translation_needed
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of Primary Languages (CntPrimaryLanguages) in the country that have a Bible Status of **Translation Needed**.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get a total matching that number.

parameters.name: translation_started
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of Primary Languages (CntPrimaryLanguages) in the country that have a Bible Status of **Translation Started**.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get a total matching that number.

parameters.name: translation_unspecified
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum total number of Primary Languages (CntPrimaryLanguages) in the country that have a Bible Status of **Unspecified**.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get a total matching that number.

parameters.name: window1040
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want countries in the 1040 Window.

200.description: The results of your filtered countries.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a specific language.
get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific Language by supplying the language's [3 letter ISO 639-2 Code](http://goo.gl/gbkgo4).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The 3 letter ISO 639-2 Language Code for the Language you want to view. [View all Language Codes](http://goo.gl/gbkgo4)

200.description: The details about the specific language.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a set of languages.
get.description: Find all languages that match your filter criteria.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more countries to filter by. Use the 2 letter FIPS 10-4 code. [View all Country Codes](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J)

parameters.name: has_audio
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want languages who have access to audio Bibles.

parameters.name: has_completed_bible
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want languages who have access to a completed Bible.

parameters.name: has_jesus_film
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want languages who have access to the Jesus Film.

parameters.name: has_new_testament
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want languages who have access to the New Testament.

parameters.name: has_portions
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want languages who have access to the portions of the Bible.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more language codes to filter by. Use the 3 letter ISO code. See this chart for the codes.

parameters.name: jpscale
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more JPScale codes to filter by. Only accepts the following codes: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.  For more information check out [https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress](https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress).

parameters.name: least_reached
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want languages that are least reached.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum results to return.

parameters.name: needs_translation_questionable
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want Languages whose need for Bible translation is questionable.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to display.

parameters.name: pc_adherent
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Adherents.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get Languages matching that percentage.

parameters.name: pc_evangelical
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Evangelicals.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get People Groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: primary_religions
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more primary religions to filter by. Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = Christianity
 * **2** = Buddhism
 * **4** = Ethnic Religions
 * **5** = Hinduism
 * **6** = Islam
 * **7** = Non-Religious
 * **8** = Other/Small
 * **9** = Unknown

200.description: The languages filtered by your query.

get.summary: Retrieve the Unreached of the Day information (JSON or XML)
get.description:
Retrieve the daily Unreached of the Day people group information. You have two options when retrieving the Unreached of the Day:
 * Get today's Unreached of the Day. This is the default if you do not send parameters.
 * You can specify the month and day parameter to get a specific day of the year. For example, `/daily_unreached.json?month=01&day=31` will get the people group for Jan. 31st. You must provide both parameters!

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The two digit day that you want to receive the information from. Defaults to the current day.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The two digit month that you want to receive the information from. Defaults to the current month.

200.description: The unreached people group based on your request.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a specific people group (JSON or XML)
get.description:
Retrieve the details of a specific people group around the world or in a specific country.  You can either:
 * Get a summary of all occurances of the people group by supplying the PeopleGroup.id (PeopleID3) only, or
 * Get the details of a specific people group in a specific country by providing the PeopleGroup.id (PeopleID3) and the country's [2 letter FIPS 10-4 Code](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Joshua Project's PeopleID3.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country's 2 letter FIPS 10-4 Code specified at [https://goo.gl/yYWY4J](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J).

200.description: The details of the specified people group.

get.summary: Search all people groups with diverse filters (JSON or XML)
get.description: Find all people groups that match your filter criteria.

parameters.name: bible_status
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more BibleStatus levels. Only accepts the following codes: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.  The statuses are:
 * **0** = Unspecified
 * **1** = Translation needed
 * **2** = Translation started
 * **3** = Portions
 * **4** = New Testament
 * **5** = Complete Bible

parameters.name: continents
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more continents to filter by. Use the following codes:
 * **AFR** = Africa
 * **ASI** = Asia
 * **AUS** = Australia
 * **EUR** = Europe
 * **NAR** = North America
 * **SOP** = Oceania (South Pacific)
 * **LAM** = South America

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more countries to filter by. Use the 2 letter FIPS 10-4 code. [View all Country Codes](https://goo.gl/yYWY4J).

parameters.name: indigenous
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want people groups that are indigenous.

parameters.name: is_frontier
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want people groups that are frontier people groups.

parameters.name: jpscale
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more JPScale codes to filter by. Only accepts the following codes: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.  For more information check out [https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress](https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress).

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more language codes to filter by. Use the 3 letter ISO code.  See the [code list](http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) for the codes.

parameters.name: least_reached
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want people groups that are least reached.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum results to return.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to display.

parameters.name: pc_adherent
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Adherents.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage.

parameters.name: pc_buddhist
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Buddhist.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_ethnic_religion
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Ethnic Religions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_evangelical
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Evangelicals.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_hindu
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Hindus.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_islam
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Islam.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_non_religious
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Non-Religious.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_other_religion
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Other Religions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_unknown
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Unkown Religions.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: people_id1
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Joshua Project affinity block codes to filter by. See [https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#affinity-bloc](https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#affinity-bloc).

parameters.name: people_id2
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Joshua Project people cluster codes to filter by. See [https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#people-cluster](https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#people-cluster).

parameters.name: people_id3
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Joshua Project people group codes to filter by.

parameters.name: population
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum population.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups with a population matching that number.

parameters.name: population_pgac
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum population for the people group in all countries (PGAC).(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups with a population matching that number.

parameters.name: primary_religions
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more primary religions to filter by. Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = Christianity
 * **2** = Buddhism
 * **4** = Ethnic Religions
 * **5** = Hinduism
 * **6** = Islam
 * **7** = Non-Religious
 * **8** = Other/Small
 * **9** = Unknown

parameters.name: regions
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more regions to filter by. Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = South Pacific
 * **2** = Southeast Asia
 * **3** = Northeast Asia
 * **4** = South Asia
 * **5** = Central Asia
 * **6** = Middle East and North Africa
 * **7** = East and Southern Africa
 * **8** = West and Central Africa
 * **9** = Eastern Europe and Eurasia
 * **10** = Western Europe
 * **11** = Central and South America
 * **12** = North America and Caribbean

parameters.name: rop1
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Registry of People affinity block codes to filter by.

parameters.name: rop2
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Registry of People people cluster codes to filter by.

parameters.name: rop3
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Registry of People people group codes to filter by.

parameters.name: window1040
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want people groups in the 1040 Window.

200.description: The list of people groups based off your criteria.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a specific people group across countries. (JSON or XML)
get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific people group across the countries they reside.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Joshua Project's PeopleID3.

parameters.name: include_country_list
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want to include a list of countries that they reside in. (Default: Y)

200.description: The details of the specified people group.

get.summary: Search all people groups across countries based on provided filters. (JSON or XML)
get.description: Search through all the various people groups across the countries they reside in.

parameters.name: include_country_list
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want to include a list of countries that they reside in. (Default: Y)

parameters.name: is_frontier
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want people groups that as a whole are considered frontier people groups.

parameters.name: jpscale
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more JPScale codes to filter by. Only accepts the following codes: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.  For more information check out [https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress](https://joshuaproject.net/global/progress).

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more language codes to filter by. Use the 3 letter ISO code.  See the [code list](http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) for the codes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum results to return.

parameters.name: number_of_countries
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum number of countries the people group resides in.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups with that matching number of countries.

parameters.name: number_of_unreached
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum number of people groups in country (PGIC) that are considered unreached.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups that match that number.

parameters.name: number_of_frontier
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum number of people groups in country (PGIC) that are considered a frontier people group.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups that match that number.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to display.

parameters.name: pc_christian
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Christians among the people group.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: pc_evangelical
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum percentage of Evangelicals among the people group.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups matching that percentage. Decimals accepted!

parameters.name: people_id1
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Joshua Project affinity block codes to filter by. See [https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#affinity-bloc](https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#affinity-bloc).

parameters.name: people_id2
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Joshua Project people cluster codes to filter by. See [https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#people-cluster](https://joshuaproject.net/help/definitions#people-cluster).

parameters.name: people_id3
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more ethnicity codes to filter by.

parameters.name: population
parameters.description: A dashed seperated range specifying the minimum and maximum population.(min-max) You can supply just the minimum to get people groups with a population matching that number.

parameters.name: primary_religions
parameters.description:
A bar separated list of one or more primary religions to filter by. Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = Christianity
 * **2** = Buddhism
 * **4** = Ethnic Religions
 * **5** = Hinduism
 * **6** = Islam
 * **7** = Non-Religious
 * **8** = Other/Small
 * **9** = Unknown

parameters.name: rop3
parameters.description: A bar separated list of one or more Registry of People IDs to filter by.

parameters.name: unreached
parameters.description: A boolean (represented as a string Y or N) that states whether you want people groups that are as a whole considered unreached.

200.description: The details of the specified people group.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a specific Region (JSON or XML)
get.description:
Retrieve the details of a specific Region by supplying a unique id for the region.  Use the following numbers:
 * **1** = South Pacific
 * **2** = Southeast Asia
 * **3** = Northeast Asia
 * **4** = South Asia
 * **5** = Central Asia
 * **6** = Middle East and North Africa
 * **7** = East and Southern Africa
 * **8** = West and Central Africa
 * **9** = Eastern Europe and Eurasia
 * **10** = Western Europe
 * **11** = Central and South America
 * **12** = North America and Caribbean

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique id for the region. Use the codes indicated above.

200.description: The details about the specific region.

get.summary: Retrieve the global total for a specific id (case insensitive) in various formats. (JSON or XML)
get.description: Retrieve the global total for a specific id (case insensitive). Look at the [column descriptions](/v1/docs/column_descriptions/totals) for Totals to see all the provided information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique total id (case insensitive).

get.summary: Retrieve global totals in various formats. (JSON or XML)
get.description: Retrieve various global totals including total Christian people groups, continents, reagions and many more. Look at the [column descriptions](/v1/docs/column_descriptions/totals) for Totals to see all the provided information.
